section.title: Purpose, reason and result
section.sectiontitle: To express purpose use to + verb, in order (not) to + verb, so that + subject + verb. In order to is more formal than to and so that.
section.text1a: I'm writing to you to complain about the meal.
section.text2a: I went to the hospital so that I could visit my sister.
section.sectiontitle2: To give a reason use because + subject + verb.
section.text3a: I bought this bike because I want to get fit.
section.text4a: I haven't written for ages because I've been busy.

section.title: Purpose, reason and result
section.sectiontitle: To explain a result use so + subject + verb.
section.text1a: We booked early so we had very good seats in the theatre.
section.text2a: It rained during the match so we all got very wet.
